                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the public health law and the insurance law, in relation
         to the reimbursement of out-of-network providers of clinical laborato-
         ry services  by  organizations  providing  or  offering  comprehensive
         health services plans

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 4406 of the public health law is amended by  adding
    2  a new subdivision 6 to read as follows:
    3    6.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  OTHER  PROVISION  OF  LAW, IF AN ENROLLEE IS
    4  REFERRED BY AN IN-PLAN PROVIDER TO A  PROVIDER  OF  CLINICAL  LABORATORY
    5  SERVICES NOT PARTICIPATING IN THE PLAN (A "NON-PARTICIPATING PROVIDER"),
    6  ANY  SERVICE THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE COVERED AS AN IN-PLAN SERVICE UNDER
    7  THE PLAN THAT IS PROVIDED BY THE  NON-PARTICIPATING  PROVIDER  SHALL  BE
    8  COVERED,  AND THE ORGANIZATION SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PAYMENT DIRECTLY
    9  TO THE NON-PARTICIPATING PROVIDER FOR THOSE SERVICES IN ACCORDANCE  WITH
   10  THE TIME FRAME FOR SUCH PAYMENTS SET FORTH IN SECTION THREE THOUSAND TWO
   11  HUNDRED  TWENTY-FOUR-A OF THE INSURANCE LAW; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT THE
   12  ENROLLEE SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY APPLICABLE COPAY,  COINSURANCE  OR
   13  DEDUCTIBLE  FOR  SUCH SERVICES. CLINICAL LABORATORIES SEEKING REIMBURSE-
   14  MENT PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED SHALL DIRECTLY  BILL
   15  THE ORGANIZATION WHOSE ENROLLEE RECEIVED THE SERVICES.  ANY PAYMENT MADE
   16  BY  AN ORGANIZATION DIRECTLY TO THE ENROLLEE RATHER THAN TO THE CLINICAL
   17  LABORATORY SEEKING REIMBURSEMENT SHALL NOT  SATISFY  THE  ORGANIZATION'S
   18  PAYMENT OBLIGATION TO THE CLINICAL LABORATORY.
   19    S  2.  Section  4804  of  the insurance law is amended by adding a new
   20  subsection (g) to read as follows:
   21    (G) NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF  LAW,  IF  AN  ENROLLEE  IS
   22  REFERRED  BY  AN  IN-PLAN  PROVIDER TO A PROVIDER OF CLINICAL LABORATORY
   23  SERVICES NOT PARTICIPATING IN THE PLAN (A "NON-PARTICIPATING PROVIDER"),

                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1  ANY SERVICE THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE COVERED AS AN IN-PLAN SERVICE  UNDER
    2  THE  PLAN  THAT  IS  PROVIDED BY THE NON-PARTICIPATING PROVIDER SHALL BE
    3  COVERED, AND THE ORGANIZATION SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PAYMENT  DIRECTLY
    4  TO  THE NON-PARTICIPATING PROVIDER FOR THOSE SERVICES IN ACCORDANCE WITH
    5  THE TIME FRAME FOR SUCH PAYMENTS SET FORTH IN SECTION THREE THOUSAND TWO
    6  HUNDRED TWENTY-FOUR-A OF  THIS  CHAPTER;  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT  THE
    7  ENROLLEE  SHALL  BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY APPLICABLE COPAY, COINSURANCE OR
    8  DEDUCTIBLE FOR SUCH SERVICES. CLINICAL LABORATORIES  SEEKING  REIMBURSE-
    9  MENT  PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED SHALL DIRECTLY BILL
   10  THE ORGANIZATION WHOSE ENROLLEE RECEIVED THE SERVICES.  ANY PAYMENT MADE
   11  BY AN ORGANIZATION DIRECTLY TO THE ENROLLEE RATHER THAN TO THE  CLINICAL
   12  LABORATORY  SEEKING  REIMBURSEMENT  SHALL NOT SATISFY THE ORGANIZATION'S
   13  PAYMENT OBLIGATION TO THE CLINICAL LABORATORY.
   14    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
